articles.title: 32M lines of AI code – GED to AGI
articles.summary: A Show HN project presenting 32 million lines of AI code as a step towards General AI Development.

articles.title: Attest – Test AI agents with 8-layer graduated assertions
articles.summary: A testing framework for AI agents with 8-layer graduated assertions: schema validation, cost/performance constraints, tool call verification, output format, semantic matching, behavior testing, end-to-end validation, and regression testing.

articles.title: Plyra-guard – intercepts AI agent tool calls before execution
articles.summary: A safety layer that intercepts AI agent tool calls before execution, evaluating them against policies and blocking, logging, or escalating as needed. Supports LangGraph, AutoGen, CrewAI, LangChain, and plain Python.

articles.title: AI-context-bridge – Save AI coding context across tools via Git hooks
articles.summary: A tool that saves AI coding context across tools via Git hooks, preventing context loss when rate limits hit.

articles.title: AI agents that control Unity, Godot, and Unreal editors
articles.summary: OpenClaw plugins for three major game engines (Unity, Godot, Unreal) that allow AI agents to control the editor directly through native APIs for creating objects, modifying scenes, and running play mode.

articles.title: Aru AI – local-first AI assistant with semantic memory in browser SQLite
articles.summary: A local-first AI assistant written entirely in Vanilla JS as a PWA with no backend, no telemetry, and no data collection. All data lives in browser SQLite with semantic memory support.

articles.title: AgentReady – Drop-in proxy that cuts LLM token costs 40-60%
articles.summary: A drop-in proxy service that reduces LLM token costs by 40-60% through intelligent compression and optimization.

articles.title: 412 deterministic modules so AI agents stop hallucinating commands
articles.summary: A project with 412 deterministic modules that prevents AI agents from hallucinating shell commands by using pre-built modules instead of having the LLM write code.

articles.title: Chinese companies distilled Claude to improve own models, Anthropic says
articles.summary: Anthropic disclosed that three Chinese companies used Claude to improperly obtain capabilities to improve their own models, following a similar disclosure by OpenAI about DeepSeek.

articles.title: Gordon: Docker's AI Agent That Understands Your Containers
articles.summary: Docker released Gordon, an AI agent purpose-built for Docker with shell access, Docker CLI access, filesystem access, and deep knowledge of Docker best practices. Available in Docker Desktop 4.61.

articles.title: Microsoft Agent Framework Reaches Release Candidate
articles.summary: Microsoft Agent Framework has reached Release Candidate status for both .NET and Python, an important milestone on the road to General Availability.

articles.title: Commotion Launches Enterprise AI Operating System Powered by NVIDIA Nemotron
articles.summary: Tata Communications launched Commotion, an Enterprise AI Operating System powered by NVIDIA Nemotron open models to scale productivity for digital workforces.

articles.title: Suna – Open Source Generalist AI Agent
articles.summary: Suna is an open-source generalist AI agent that runs locally on any OS, connecting to 100+ messaging platforms with autonomous task execution capabilities. Has gained 6,535 stars this week.

articles.title: v0-system-prompts – Full system prompts from top AI agents
articles.summary: A collection of full system prompts from v0, Cursor, Manus, Same.dev, Lovable, Devin, Replit Agent, and VSCode Agent. Has gained 32,785 stars this week.

articles.title: dia – A TTS model capable of generating ultra-realistic dialogue
articles.summary: A TTS model from nari-labs capable of generating ultra-realistic dialogue in one pass. Has gained 11,831 stars this week.

articles.title: AI Agents Take Center Stage on GitHub Trending — February 23, 2026
articles.summary: AI Agent systems dominated today's GitHub trends. From pentesting to code analysis, autonomous AI tools are redefining traditional development workflows. Over half of trending repos included the 'Agentic' keyword, with systems that make decisions and execute independently becoming the new standard for developer tools.

articles.title: n8n v2.9.2 Released — Workflow Automation Tool
articles.summary: n8n released version 2.9.2 with bug fixes including editor improvements for Chat hub, visual fixes for tools selector, and tag handling corrections. The open-source workflow automation platform continues to be a major player in the AI tooling ecosystem with 176k stars.

articles.title: pydantic-ai v1.63.0 Adds Gemini 3.1 Pro Support
articles.summary: Pydantic-ai released v1.63.0 with Gemini 3.1 Pro Preview support, logprob support for Gemini, and an args_validator parameter for tools. This GenAI agent framework continues to expand its provider support.

articles.title: Open-WebUI v0.8.5 Released with Voice Dictation Shortcut
articles.summary: Open-WebUI released v0.8.5 adding voice dictation shortcut (Cmd+Shift+L) and backend config null safety fixes. The popular LLMs web interface continues to improve with 125k stars.

articles.title: IronClaw: Open-Source Rust Implementation of OpenClaw
articles.summary: IronClaw is an OpenClaw-inspired implementation in Rust focused on privacy and security. With 3,226 stars, it provides an alternative for users seeking a Rust-based autonomous AI assistant.

articles.title: Google Gemini 3.1 Pro Raises the Bar
articles.summary: Google DeepMind released Gemini 3.1 Pro, posting record results across multiple advanced benchmarks. The model tops the charts beating Claude Opus 4.6 and GPT-5.2 on most benchmarks, with 77.1% on ARC-AGI-2.

articles.title: Google Bans OpenClaw Users on Antigravity AI Coding Tool
articles.summary: Google Antigravity users report their paid Google AI accounts were banned after linking Gemini models via OpenClaw. Following Anthropic's crackdown, Google cites massive increase in malicious usage as reason for restrictions.

articles.title: xAI Pentagon Deal: Grok to Power Classified Systems
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI and Pentagon have reached a deal to deploy Grok in classified systems. This marks a significant milestone for xAI's enterprise adoption and military applications.

articles.title: OpenAI's Stargate Data Center Project Struggles
articles.summary: OpenAI's $500 billion Stargate partnership with Oracle and SoftBank has stalled and is not developing any of OpenAI's data centers. The company is exploring individual deals with SoftBank and Oracle to secure computing power.

articles.title: Claude Sonnet 4.6 Released with Improved Coding and Agent Planning
articles.summary: Anthropic released Claude Sonnet 4.6 featuring improved skills in coding, computer use, long-context reasoning, agent planning, knowledge work, and design. Now the default model in claude.ai with 1M context window (beta).

articles.title: Comparing Amazon Q and GitHub Copilot Agentic AI in VS Code
articles.summary: Visual Studio Magazine compares Amazon Q Developer with GitHub Copilot Agentic AI in VS Code, examining how agentic AI evolves to handle complex editorial automation beyond just writing code.

articles.title: Show HN: Bt — Plan-first AI Coding Commands for OpenCode
articles.summary: A set of commands that enforce a simple discipline: no code gets written until you've reviewed and approved a written plan. Workflow: /bt-research → /bt-plan → /bt-review → /bt-implement.

articles.title: Show HN: AI Timeline — 171 LLMs from Transformer (2017) to GPT-5.3 (2026)
articles.summary: Interactive timeline of every major Large Language Model. Filterable by open/closed source, searchable, with 54 organizations tracked.

articles.title: Show HN: MarkdownLM — Stop Being the Human Middleware for Your AI Agent
articles.summary: A solution to the problem of AI agents treating project rules as suggestions. Built to ensure AI respects architectural decisions and naming conventions across sessions.

articles.title: goose v1.25.0: Sandboxed, Streamlined, and More Secure
articles.summary: Goose is an extensible, open source AI agent that enhances software development by automating coding tasks. Runs locally with full access to development environment through MCP.

articles.title: Coroot: Open-source Observability and APM Tool
articles.summary: Coroot is an open-source observability and application performance monitoring tool using eBPF technology to collect telemetry data across systems.

articles.title: AI Coding Tools May Be the End of Freemium Utility Apps
articles.summary: With the launch of tools like OpenAI's Codex, Anthropic's Claude Agent, and upcoming support in Xcode, the market for single-purpose apps might not survive as AI coding tools automate traditional development.
